thread.title: Rio Ferdinand calls out Anthony Joshua, David Haye and Tony Bellew as he shows off his questionable boxing skills
thread.title_full: Rio Ferdinand calls out Anthony Joshua, David Haye and Tony Bellew as he shows off his questionable boxing skills

author: Jake Polden
title: Rio Ferdinand calls out Anthony Joshua, David Haye and Tony Bellew as he shows off his questionable boxing skills
text:
Sport Rio Ferdinand calls out Anthony Joshua, David Haye and Tony Bellew as he shows off his questionable boxing skills The former Manchester United star must be looking for a new challenge now he has finished with football Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now     
It's always best to aim high. 
But we think Rio Ferdinand may be getting a little carried away in the hilarious video above. 
The former Manchester United centre-back was recently pictured celebrating New Year's Eve with IBF heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua. 
It seems their friendship was short lived though, as the Watford-born fighter is just one of the boxers the former footballer has decided to call out in the clip. 
Helping him with his training, as he prepares to take on the heavyweight division, is former Rugby union star Mel Deane - because you know, the footage couldn't get any more bizarre. Coming to a boxing ring near you (Photo: Rio Ferdinand / Twitter) Rio gets fighting fit (Photo: Rio Ferdinand / Twitter) 
In the video, Ferdinand starts by calling out Tony Bellew before throwing straight punches at Deane, who holds the pads. 
He stops for a breather, shouting: "David Haye, you want some? I'm hear," and then throws hooks at the bemused 41-year-old. They used to be pals, not anymore (Photo: INTERNET UNKNOWN) Haye and Bellew scrap over who gets to fight Rio first (Photo: LAWRENCE LUSTIG) 
Ferdinand concludes the clip by chucking out some short upper-cuts, but not before calling out Anthony Joshua. 
You know, as you do... poll loading Is Rio biting off more than he can chew? 0+ VOTES SO FAR Of course he isn't, he'd iron out the three of them in the one ring Like us on Facebook
